intro: Nandina, commonly known as the heavenly bamboo, is a shrub native to eastern Asia. It features clusters of small, white flowers that appear in late spring, followed by red berries in the fall. The plant has striking, feather-like leaves that turn red in autumn, adding ornamental value. It is often cultivated for its hardiness and adaptability to various soil types. Nandina is also valued for its ability to thrive in partial shade to full sun conditions.
